title: Robert Mondavi - Woodbridge font
content:
Can anyone tell me what font is used for the Woodbridge logo (the part of this label that says "Woodbridge")?

I'm also wondering what font is used for "Robert Mondavi" and "Chardonnay" (I think they are in the same font).

Also, any suggestions for something similar if the fonts are customized.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821125157im_/http:/typophile.com/files/woodbridge_5544.jpg)
author: junia119

comments.content: Woodbridge: Possibly a bold version of [Ragnar Small Caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821125157/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/ragnar/sc/) (Linotype)

"Robert Mondavi" and "Chardonnay" must be **[Byington (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821125157/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Typodermic&ffam=Byington%20-%20Bold&fid=48ae082e21d64508e7c65a3af3bd7626&fsize=48&text=BY%20ROBERT%20MONDAVI%20CHARDONNAY&wrap=2)** by Ray Larabie (Typodermic, 2005)

-----------------------------------------------  
I found it using Find my Font - [http://www.findmyfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821125157/http:/www.findmyfont.com/ "http://www.findmyfont.com")
